llama2:70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 - March 17th, 2022

* Depart from Denver in the morning (around 9:00 AM) by self-driving or taking a taxi to Bozeman, Montana. The distance is approximately 1,115 km and will take around 9 hours 46 minutes with normal traffic conditions. You can stop for lunch at any roadside restaurants that serve American or Indian cuisine.
* Upon arrival in Bozeman, check-in at a hotel with good reviews and availability for 8 people. Some recommended hotels include the Hilton Garden Inn Bozeman, Best Western Plus Grantree Inn, and Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Bozeman.
* In the evening, you can explore the city's local attractions or visit restaurants that serve American or Indian cuisine. Some recommendations include The Farmhouse Restaurant, The Ould Sod, and La Parrilla Argentina.

Day 2 - March 18th, 2022

* After breakfast at the hotel or a nearby café, you can head to Yellowstone National Park for a day trip. The park is approximately 1 hour 45 minutes from Bozeman and offers various attractions such as geysers, hot springs, and wildlife viewing. You can take a guided tour or drive around the park on your own. Make sure to bring necessary documents, water, snacks, and sunscreen.
* In the evening, you can return to Bozeman and enjoy dinner at one of the city's restaurants that serve American or Indian cuisine. Some recommendations include The Montana Kitchen, Bacchus Pub & Grill, and Taste of India.

Day 3 - March 19th, 2022

* Spend the morning shopping for souvenirs or visiting local attractions in Bozeman before departing to Denver. You can take a flight from Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (BZN) to Denver International Airport (DEN) around noon. Flight duration is approximately 1 hour 25 minutes, and you can book flights in advance to secure affordable tickets.
* Upon arrival in Denver, you can take a taxi or ride-share service back home.

Budget Breakdown:

* Transportation (self-driving or taxi): $55 - $1119 (depending on the mode of transportation and number of people)
* Accommodation (hotel for 8 people): $200 - $400 per night (for a 3-star hotel)
* Food and dining: $30 - $60 per meal (assuming 2 meals per day at an average cost of $35 per person)
* Activities and entrance fees (Yellowstone National Park): $30 - $50 per person (depending on the activities and tours chosen)
* Miscellaneous expenses (souvenirs, fuel, etc.): $100 - $200

Total estimated budget: $700 - $1400

This travel plan should fit your budget of $7,000, considering the assumptions made for transportation, accommodation, food, and activities. Please note that prices may vary depending on individual preferences and exchange rates.
